Title: Undergraduate Fractures and Orthopaedics
Author: ডা. সোমেন দাস
Summary:
This book on Traumatology and Orthopaedics is mainly intended for the undergraduate appearing for final MBBS Examination. This book is concise, comprehensive and very much exam-oriented. The author is quite well knowledge for his treatise ? A Manual On Clinical Surgery, A Concise Textbook of Surgery. In all these books he had provided considerable space for fracture and orthopaedics, so if has been easier for him to write a complete book on this subject. It has been written in a methodical and lively manner which is typical of this famous author. If this book helps in learning the 'basics' of fracture and orthopaedics, it has done its purpose.

About The Author
Author, Dr. S. Das, possesses a distinguished academic career. He graduated from Calcutta Medical College University. During his undergraduate career in Calcutta Medical (CMC), he was Good-Eve Scholar. He was offered Certified of Merit in Anatomy, Surgery and Obstetrics and Gynaecology. He received Medals in Operative Surgery and Surgical Anatomy. He scored highest mark in Anatomy among CMC students in First MBBS Examination and highest mark in Surgery among CMC students in Final MBBS Examination.

He was Honours in Anatomy, Calcutta University. After his internship and extensive training both General Surgery and Orthopaedics and Traumatology. He became Fellow of Royal College of Surgeons of Edinburgh and London in first attempts before his 28th Birthday. Thus he is probably the youngest Fellow in India. After that, he held responsible post in the department of General Surgery and Orthopaedic and Fractures in different hospitals in United Kingdom including a few posts in teaching institutions.

His biodata has been include in International 'who's who' for his contribution in the field of teaching Surgery.
